intro: Ipomoea arborescens, commonly known as the coral vine, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a climbing vine that produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and orange. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun. Ipomoea arborescens is also known for its rapid growth and ability to cover trellises or fences quickly.
